comments:
Integration build 20020508 (1411)

0. Brand new install
1. launch eclipse.exe
2. Help -> Update Manager

Observe: The configuration view is empty.  The workspace log
is indicating that update manager is having trouble getting started.

Expectation: The configuration view should show the current configuration.

.log follows

Unable to reproduce so far.
Will protect code from NPE error.

can you try to delete platform.cfg and platform.cfg.metadata and restart ?

It seems the file system parser fails, but the second CoreException doesn't show
the trace.

Did you pick up today 14:11 integration build (not an earlier one),
do a clean install, and launch from eclipse.exe?
If you cannot reproduce this, there's something very wrong with my setup.

I'm running ibm-jre-n131p-win32-x86 on on Windows XP.

Downloaded 
downloads/drops/I-20020508-200205081411/index.php
using
java version "1.3.1"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1-b24)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.1-b24, mixed mode)
on NT sp6
Verified eclipse.exe is from 5/8/02 2:42pm

will attempt with other JDK, nevertheless, tracing is not very good and should
be changed

Can you copy .options from org.eclipse.update.core , and use following options
to true

org.eclipse.update.core/debug=true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/warning=true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/parsing=true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/install=false
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/configuration=true
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/type=false
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/web=false
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/installhandler=false
org.eclipse.update.core/debug/reconciler=true


run with -debug and append the trace ?

Tried with 
E:\eclipse-SDK-20020508\eclipse>e:\IBMJDK131\jre\bin\java.exe -version
java version "1.3.1"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1)
Classic VM (build 1.3.1, J2RE 1.3.1 IBM Windows 32 build cn131-20020403 (JIT
enabled: jitc))

Same result (opens fine)

I'm unable to recreate this problem I was seeing before.
The install which I was using is now working fine.
I unzipped a new install, and it is also working fine.
I have no idea what was wrong, and why it cleared up (it
happened many times in a row).

Things to change
1)We got an NPE
2)The trace doesn't explain what was wrong and is useless (see with
CoreException how to preserve error message and stack trace using multistatus)

Things to check
it seems the 'file parser' chocked on something in the file system. Do you
recall any plugin as jar file or anything else under feature and or plugins ?

Bingo!  I had selected individual feature and plug-in subdirectories
and does an "add to xxx.zip" in Windows Explorer, which created
zip files under the <install>/eclipse/features/ and <install>/eclipse/plugins/
(I also renamed some of them to *.jar). The code is probably everything
in these directories is a directory, and is freaking out when it encounters
a file.

Ok,
we will fix it

1) we should not have the NPE
2) we should trace better
3) we should have a better error message to the user

Agree there should be no NPE, and better tracing would be useful.
re: 3 - files in the plugins/ or features/ directories should be silently 
ignored (do not log, and do not inform the user).

I have a slightly different failure pattern likely caused by the same handling. 
Using the base scenario as here ... brand new 20020508, but I added the new 001 
feature and plugin before the initial start, but have renamed feature.xml to 
feature.xml.off and plugin.xml to plugin.xml.off (so it does not get picked up 
by the startup code). We get all the way into the startup reconciler, but fail 
with NPE.
